item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 27, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Open Source on its own is no alternative to Big Tech (31 points | 25 comments)
2. Shrunked JavaScript monorepo Git size by 94% (105 points | 44 comments)
3. I discovered mysterious hidden signals on a public radio channel (2013) [video] (133 points | 26 comments)
4. Typeset: An HTML pre-proces­sor for web ty­pog­ra­phy (28 points | 10 comments)
5. James Webb Telescope discovers some quasars that seem to exist in isolation (57 points | 3 comments)
6. Are Rotary Mixers Better? (13 points | 4 comments)
7. Understanding Round Robin DNS (273 points | 99 comments)
8. First scientific study of the Paris catacombs (28 points | discuss)
9. Canvas Fingerprinting (81 points | 71 comments)
10. How JPEG XL compares to other image codecs (103 points | 33 comments)
11. How 'Factorio' seduced Silicon Valley and me (199 points | 229 comments)
12. Comparison of configuration file languages (2016) (10 points | 2 comments)
13. Codeberg Reconsidering OSI License Approval in Terms of Use (26 points | 1 comment)
14. ZombAIs: From Prompt Injection to C2 with Claude Computer Use (119 points | 58 comments)
15. Moonshine, the new state of the art for speech to text (48 points | 7 comments)
16. Debugging my wife's alarm clock (35 points | 11 comments)
17. How the human brain contends with the strangeness of zero (21 points | 17 comments)
18. Using LLMs to enhance our testing practices (108 points | 48 comments)
19. Fundamentals of Radiance Cascades (85 points | 21 comments)
20. Olivetti’s Ivrea (59 points | 11 comments)
21. Tell HN: GpuOwl/PRPLL, GPU software used to find the largest prime number (50 points | 17 comments)
22. Bias and Deviation Weighted Graph Search for NLOS Indoor RTLS Calibration (3 points | discuss)
23. Stunning fossil trapped in amber reveals previously unknown species (8 points | 1 comment)
24. Using a BCI with LLM for enabling ALS patients to speak again with family (43 points | 16 comments)
25. Carma (YC W24) hiring founding SWEs (remote) to build the next Uber for auto repair ( | hide)
26. Goodhart's law isn't as useful as you might think (2023) (76 points | 42 comments)
27. The Fediverse is getting its own TikTok competitor called Loops (24 points | 18 comments)
28. DragonRuby Game Toolkit hits v6.0 (8 points | discuss)
29. Slot Machines Walk into a Bar: Adventures in Quantity over Quality [video] (9 points | discuss)
30. Order and orient the keys on your keychain (55 points | 67 comments)
